meanings.definition: In a manner that asserts opinions or beliefs as if they are absolutely true.
meanings.sent1: She spoke dogmatically, insisting that her way was the only correct way.
meanings.sent2: He always talks dogmatically, never considering other viewpoints.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed dogmatically, convinced that it was the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: The tree stood dogmatically, rooted firmly in its spot despite the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained dogmatically, making sure everyone understood the concept clearly.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is stubbornly or arrogantly assertive.
meanings.sent1: She refused to listen to others, speaking dogmatically about her ideas.
meanings.sent2: The manager always acts dogmatically, never considering suggestions from the team.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel chattered dogmatically, claiming all the nuts for itself.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood dogmatically, resisting any attempts at renovation.
meanings.sent5: The child insisted dogmatically, refusing to eat any vegetables.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is inflexible or rigid in adherence to principles or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: He followed the rules dogmatically, never deviating from the set guidelines.
meanings.sent2: The group leader led dogmatically, enforcing strict discipline among the members.
meanings.sent3: The clock ticked dogmatically, never missing a beat.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood dogmatically, unmoved by the passing of time.
meanings.sent5: The robot operated dogmatically, following its programmed instructions precisely.
